variants.Description in input context: E46K mutation increased the propensity of ␣-synuclein to fibrillize
A53T mutation increased the propensity of ␣-synuclein to fibrillize
E46A mutation increased the assembly of ␣-synuclein
E83A mutation increased polymerization but perturbed some of the properties of mature amyloid
E83K mutation increased polymerization but perturbed some of the properties of mature amyloid

Material used.Description: Recombinant human ␣-synuclein proteins were expressed in Escherichia coli BL21(DE3).

Readout description.Result Description: E46K mutant polymerized more readily than the WT protein but that the effect was not as dramatic as the change seen in the A53T mutant.
A53T mutation increased the propensity of ␣-synuclein to fibrillize to a greater extent than the E46K mutation.
E46A mutation increased the assembly of ␣-synuclein.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: increased polymerization but perturbed some of the properties of mature amyloid
Readout description.Result Description: E83A mutation increased polymerization but perturbed some of the properties of mature amyloid.
